metadata.Title: CVE-2018-10936 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description: A weakness was found in postgresql-jdbc before version 42.2.5. It was possible to provide an SSL Factory and not check the host name if a host name verifier was not provided to the driver. This could lead to a condition where a man-in-the-middle attacker could masquerade as a trusted server by providing a certificate for the wrong host, as long as it was signed by a trusted CA.

criterions.comment: libpgjava: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
